definition: to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
lit. cutting and polishing (idiom)/fig. to learn by exchanging ideas or experiences

sentences.english: I'm thinking in terms of a visit to Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我正切磋去巴黎渴念景仰。

sentences.english: Mahjong rooms are also available for those who wants to pit their skills against each other.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，我们还拥有多个麻将室供游客切磋技艺。

sentences.english: Although there is a language barrier, Master Yang and Scot have met many times already.
sentences.chinese: 虽说语言不通，杨老师和格瑞已经切磋多次了。

sentences.english: Yang Yuanhong to direct the poetry. and sinologist Bunn TON.
sentences.chinese: 与汉学家霍布恩先生切磋。

sentences.english: The basketball players of the two countries got together and compared notes after the match.
sentences.chinese: 两国篮球运动员在比赛后聚在一起，切磋球艺。

sentences.english: He said that exchanges between different cultures are very important.
sentences.chinese: 他说，不同文化的相互切磋非常重要。

sentences.english: I hope that you can learn Chinese through contributing to Chinese Wikipedia.
sentences.chinese: 希望你学好中文，我们也愿意在编写中互相切磋。

sentences.english: They were honed down to the essence, sculpted like stones.
sentences.chinese: 雕刻一般，切磋琢磨成为精华。

sentences.english: Chess & Card Room with automatic mahjong machine, and your friends can learn skills together.
sentences.chinese: 棋牌室有自动麻将机，可以与您的朋友一起切磋技艺。

sentences.english: I am anxious to meet you tomorrow to hash out the details.
sentences.chinese: 我急着想跟你明天碰面，切磋一些细节。

sentences.english: To discuss the scientific research of the plaster therapy from the aspect of health maintainence.
sentences.chinese: 从摄生防病的角度切磋药物敷贴疗法的科研思绪。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the risk factors and pathogenic characteristics of hospitalacquired septicemia in elderly patients.
sentences.chinese: 目的切磋老年院内传染败血病危险因素与病原菌特点。

definition: to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
martial arts competition/tournament/to compete in a contest
to observe and emulate/to study (esp. following sb's example)
single-elimination open tournament (the winner stays on until he is himself defeated)
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
Chinese boxing/fist and feet/punching and kicking
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
